document_content.title: Referral to General Medicine for Evaluation of Chronic Fatigue

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Rowen is being referred for further evaluation of chronic fatigue and intermittent joint pain of unclear etiology. Symptoms have persisted for over 6 months with no significant improvement despite conservative management.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports persistent fatigue, low-grade fevers, and migratory arthralgias affecting her wrists and knees. She denies any significant weight loss, rash, or night sweats. Over-the-counter analgesics have provided minimal relief. No recent travel or known tick exposure.

sections.heading: Past Medical History
sections.content: No significant past medical history. No known allergies. Up to date on routine vaccinations.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Occasional ibuprofen as needed for joint discomfort.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: Vitals stable. Mild tenderness in wrists and knees without visible swelling or erythema. No lymphadenopathy. Cardiac, respiratory, abdominal, and neurological examinations are unremarkable.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Recent laboratory tests: CBC within normal limits, ESR mildly elevated at 28 mm/hr, normal renal and liver function tests. ANA screening pending.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the chronicity of symptoms and elevated ESR, further evaluation for possible autoimmune or inflammatory conditions is requested. Please advise regarding additional investigations and management.
